title: The message cannot be moved or copied to folder 'Trash on...
content: I have 235 message filters because this is an old email account, that financial spammers have shared. When I now start Moxilla I get the message "The message cannot be moved or copied to folder 'Trash on..." when it gets to one of the message filters. It downloads all the POP messages, good and filtered. If I leave Moxilla OPEN and new filtered message come in later on that day, Moxilla handles all new messages correctly. The local "Trash" folder is somehow locked but unlocked later in the day. (Windows 11, this just started October 2023)
creator: jg10

title: latest update (?) hoses email access for all accounts
content:
I am s-o-o-o gd tired of this happening. Every time it does, I spend days-to-weeks trying to recover a working edition of Tbird. Why can't you build updates that don't lock a customer out of his/her own emails.

I don't know how or when, exactly, it happened. I use Win11pro which is up to date. I have one Tbird install on dropbox so I can access all my emails from any of four different machines. It worked yesterday (on two machines at any rate, I didn't use the others). Today, no matter which machine I log into, I get an message stating that I ' you have launched an older version of Thunderbird. A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version. Use this profile only with that newer version, or create a new profile for this installation of Thunderbird. Creating a new profile requires setting up your accounts, calendars and ad-ons again. For more information . . .italic text Then it gives an 'exit' button and a 'create new profile' button.

1) I did NOT install a new version of Thunderbird.

2) Insofar as I can tell, the version on Dropbox has not changed so nothing should have altered the profile.

3) I do NOT want to create a new profile -- I have years of data in calendars and emails across multiple accounts.

4) the 'more information' link doesn't work.

Why do you periodically do this to me, Mo? Why can't you make changes that don't destroy a person's account(s), profiles or data? Why do you put up such a useless message without a utility to restore things to the way they should be?

5) I have been searching the internet for hours and I don't see a solution to this problem.
creator: obieephyhm

title: Threaded view keeps turning back on by itself
content:
I am using version 115.5.1 of Thunderbird, all my folders are set to unthreaded view but Thunderbird will regularly turn one or several folders back to threaded view. When I say regularly I mean almost one time or more per 8 hours work day. I tried to identify a pattern, an action, a keyboard combination, anything really but I can't seem to find it. Today I literally just stepped away from my screen, came back 20 minutes later and found my folder in threaded view. It is driving me crazy.

How can I stop Thunderbird from forcing me to use this threaded view I do not want?

title: Unable to add or import gmail-account "Authentication failure"
content:
Hi all, Setting up a new computer and Thunderbird. Did a clean install and trying to add my gmail account. Typed in name, e-mail and password. Retrieve configuration from Mozilla ISP database successfully. Then when i click "Done" I get the google pop-up where I click allow Thunderbird, and the pop-up closes. Then I get a yellow notice in Thunderbird saying "Unable to login at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password."

Username/pass is correct, and configuration is from Mozilla. Tried manually and get a success when i click Re-test button.

Tried a bunch of times over the last few days. Always the same. I have no problems logging in to gmail in using my browser and the same credentials.

I'm at a loss here, thankful for any help.

Cheers!

title: Thunderbir dělá nesmyslné věci

title: Remote content still* showing in the junk folder emails
content:
I have 'allow remote content in messages' off (never turned it on) yet this email and a few others that's in my junk folder (outlook has filtered it there I guess) seems to be automatically turning on remote content. In this case an image is being displayed in a junk email.

When I mark it as junk it does seem to not show remote content, but I sometimes go through my junk and think an email isn't junk and open it, but by that time it's displayed the remote content without me actually turning it on.

What's going on here? How can I make sure the "Junk" folder is not automatically showing remote content like this?

P.S. the 'Privacy and security settings | Thunderbird Help' page seems to be needing an update over at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird/privacy-and-security-settings

title: Thunderbird suddenly does not check one of my email accounts anymore.
content:
Hi guys.

A couple of days ago Thunderbird would not show that its checking my private email account anymore. I tried some of your solutions like removing the saved password for the account. But it never starts to check the account so it never comes to the point where it asks for the password. I also checked the email provider and I could login into webmail and see all mails. Furthermore I tried to send email from that account and it worked fine.

There are only 2 accounts, one is gmail the other is an "email only account from one.com".

I have ofcourse looked into status from one.com and there has been no problems. I used to use POP and have even tried IMAP for that account. But no matter what its not checking or even trying to connect to that account. It never shows in the bottom left corner that its checking that account only the gmail account.

I have used Thunderbird for many years and I really like the product. I hope someone has a way to troubleshoot this as I would like to continue to use Thunderbird.

Thanks
creator: thakangbaby

title: How to filter from raw message/source?
content:
As the title asks, how can I filter from the raw message? Not the body or header, but from the source?

I seem to be plagued with targeted spam, yes it's going in the junk folder and I believe I am utilizing SpamAssassin and training it to work as best as possible.

The problem is when going through my junk folder to double check if there are any false positives (there always is), I can't see anything with the ton of junk in there, so I've used very unique filters to just delete most of them, however my filters would be much more simple and efficient if I could filter using the source. In fact I could reduce my filters from 10 to 1.
creator: savas

title: Email threading
content: Hi This morning, when I wasn't at the computer, my emails suddenly all changed! To explain, I keep my emails in date order with the latest received emails at the bottom of the list. When I came back to the computer, 5 unconnected emails from different recipients had all 'threaded' under one email recipient - they are all from dates in September, October and November now listed in the middle of todays received emails. Using the help topic 'Ignoring Threads' didn't help, as when I clicked on the View menu I only have submenus - Toolbars/Layout/Folders - no Threads menu. If I right click on any of the messages, clicking on either Ignore Thread or Ignore Subthread, makes no difference. I have done an Alt Print Screen, but can't save that as a .jpeg in order to attach it - is there some other way I can send a copy? Thanks in advance for your help! Sue Minns

title: ics files are not visible in Thunderbird.  Not inline.  Not as attachments.  Message appears completely blank
content:
I'm a long time TB user on MacOS and make monthly contributions to support it. In its current incarnation, however, it seems unusable to me.

ics files do not appear as attachments, neither do they appear in the message body. I used to use receive ics files as attachments. More recently they appeared in the message body. Now they don't appear at all. This makes it impossible to update my calendar, manually or otherwise.

The ics file is there. I can see it in ios mail. Here's a snippet from the source from within TB:

--_002_CO3PR03MB675912291E94D263E68E6D44C284ACO3PR03MB6759namp_ Content-Type: text/calendar; charset="utf-8"; method=REQUEST Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

I'm using TB 115.5.1 on MacOS 14.1.2

Thanks for guidance. -PB

title: Lost My Local Folders
content:
I purchased a new computer and downloaded and installed Thunderbird using the instructions for installation for the att.net server. It seems to have downloaded all the mail from the "inbox" and is continuing to receive mail but none of the sub folders under the "Local Folders" were brought over. I've read this thread (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1363277) but can't seem to understand what it is I'm supposed to be looking for or do. The new PC has a 225 mb SSD on which all the programs are installed (drive C:) I searched for files containing "Thunderbird" and found several one of which is C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Roaming and another named C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Local. This happened when I had a new hard drive installed in my old computer but I can't seem to remember what I had to do to get everything back onto the new equipment.

Can someone help me to get these folders, and the mail they contain, back?

Thank you, Joe
creator: joseph-rowland
